reviewText: Read my comments about the first three 3D DVD's of the series.  Disck were defective, Ladies were anything but hot, middle aged, overweight women in 50s swim wear.  Stay away from these DVDs.  Read the 5 star reviews.  All written by the same individual, owner perhaps?
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the 2nd title in this series that I have checked out.  The 3D here is even stronger with more depth of field than 3D Bikini Beach Babes #5.  I'm not really into the girls with guns thing that much so I must admit that I didn't enjoy this as much as the Beach disc, but fans of this type of female eye candy and Andy Sidaris in particular are especially going to love this.The main program runs for 81 minutes, and there are plentiful special features.  Let's run those down first - there is a 20 minute 3D slide show (which, like the main program, also plays in 2D for those of you without 3D televisions), another 39 minute slide show, a 34 minute featurette on the Code Red Airsoft Park (with action vignettes and a behind the scenes tour of the facility), a 9 minute segment at Paintball Airsoft Military Surplus (featuring the girls trying on the equipment and handling the weapons {in their bikinis of course}), and a 12 minute trailer reel of the other 3D Bikini Girls titles.There are 12 girls in all.  Looking at the time spent indoors here, the footage shows the girls visiting the Military Surplus shop, being interviewed individually, participating in photo shoots alone and in groups with and without guns, taking some target practice indoors, goofing around with giant boxing gloves and jumping around the inside of a bounce house trampoline.A good amount of time is also spent outside in the airsoft park, and this is where this title shines as far as its 3D presentation.  Outdoor footage like this naturally looks the best in 3D and lends itself well to the action play scenarios provided here.  The camera can be a little shaky at times due to the quick moving around required to keep up with the girls, but the 3D dimensionality found here is hard to beat.  The girls use both paintball and airsoft guns during the outside action, and whenever they are maneuvering around the course outside they use protective headgear.  You never see anyone fire guns or get hit with any paintball pellets, as I imagine that would hurt a lot on bare skin.  There's really no need to mar those attractive bikini bodies, although I suppose one could argue about a lack of realism here.Many of the girls return from Bikini Babes #5, and while there is definitely some time spent focusing on the bikini bodies, that is overshadowed here to some degree by the paintball and airsoft activities.  There is a lot of time spent outside in the play field and this where I found my attention wavering a bit with all of the Call Of Duty-type maneuvering around the wooden structures.  Overall, I would say this title is highly recommended to fans of 3D & girls with guns, strongly recommended to 3D fans who buy titles for the quality of the 3D alone, and midly recommended to those who are in this mainly for the girls and the bikinis.
summary: Effective 3D presentation, girls with guns so your mileage may vary

reviewText: I think the the girls had fun making this, getting to play with big guns, without the kick or recoil.The guys making the film probably had fun too, for the first 5 or 10 minutes.After that, boredom sets in. The girls are pretty, the scenery ordinary, making the whole experience pretty ordinary.This might give a few minutes of fun for paintball players, or more likely, the chair-bound wannabees, but for me, yet another waste of a dollar.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I don't know whose idea it was to have 12 bikini clad girls just shoot one another with Paintball guns, but, whoever did is GENIUS. I was looking forward to this title for a while, and the anticipation LIVED UP WELL. I highly enjoyed this blu-ray, a lot of fun, hot girls, and Painballs. Great Combo!!
